about.summary: Constructs paths to your project's files. The 'here()' function uses a reasonable heuristics to find your project's files, based on the current working directory at the time when the package is loaded. Use it as a drop-in replacement for 'file.path()', it will always locate the files relative to your project root.

name: r-here
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '0.1' %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}
{% set native = 'm2w64-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-here
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  fn: here_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/here_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/here/here_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 5ba5e7d9002fc85bc633706b7ee486505c12b0bf5ecb177028bec6db706f65ed

build:
  noarch: generic
  merge_build_host: True  # [win]
  number: 1003
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-rprojroot >=1.2
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-rprojroot >=1.2

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('here')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('here')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/krlmlr/here, http://krlmlr.github.io/here
  license: GPL-3
  summary: Constructs paths to your project's files. The 'here()' function uses a reasonable
    heuristics to find your project's files, based on the current working directory
    at the time when the package is loaded. Use it as a drop-in replacement for 'file.path()',
    it will always locate the files relative to your project root.
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file: '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - brisk022
    - johanneskoester
    - bgruening
    - daler
    - jdblischak
    - cbrueffer
    - dbast
smithy_version:
No azure token. Create a token and
put it in ~/.conda-smithy/azure.token
3.7.0
